body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Are there four distinct positive integers such that adding the product of any two of them to 2006 yields a\nperfect square?"}]}]}

title: 2006 AIME II Problem 14
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let  S("},{"type":"text","text":"n","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":") be the sum of the reciprocals of the non-zero digits of the integers from 1 to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  inclusive. Find the smallest positive integer "},{"type":"text","text":"n","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" for which S("},{"type":"text","text":"n","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":") is an integer."}]}]}
